item.title: structured logging - slog
item.description: Logs (of events) is one of the three pillar of observability (traces and metrics are the other two). A log entry is a timestamp record about the application’s activity, it can be used for troubleshooting, monitoring or auditing purposes. Logs may have different formats: unstructured or plain text: similar to print statements, free-form text semi-structured: some values have a structure and the remaining data free-form structured: there is a well-defined and consistent format, for example: W3C Log Format, NCSA Log Format, Key/Value Pair, CSV or JSON, between others.
